de.nec.nle.siafu.model

Class SimulationData

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.nec.nle.siafu.model.SimulationData
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DirectorySimulationData, JarSimulationData

    public abstract class SimulationData
extends Object
    The subclasses of SimulationData encapsulate the simulation information, including the agent, world and context models, the configuration file, the image maps and the sprites. They provide an easy interface to retreive all the information. In order to get your SimulationData object, get an instance of the subclass by passing the path string to the getInstance method. Currently, only a folder or a jar file is supported. TODO:Document the jar/folder structure
    Author:
    Miquel Martin

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String BACKGROUND_FILE
      Path to the backgroundimage of the simulation data.
      protected URLClassLoader classLoader
      The class loader used to include the simulation behavior classes into the classpath.
      static String CONFIG_FILE
      Path to the simulation configuration.
      static String OVERLAYS_PATH
      Path to overlay files, which define context variables on the map.
      static String PLACES_PATH
      Path to place files, which indicate the positions where a place of a certain type should be placed.
      static String WALLS_FILE
      Path to the walls image of the simulation data.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static SimulationData getInstance(String pathString)
        Get an instance of the right subclass of SimulationData by taking the path to the simulation data as parameter.
        Parameters:
        pathString - the absolute path to the simulation data, currently, a jar file or a folder
        Returns:
        a SimulationData instance of the right subclass

      • getAgentModelClass

        public Class<? extends BaseAgentModel> getAgentModelClass()
        Get the AgentModel using the class loader set to the simulation data path.
        Returns:
        the AgentModel for this simulation

      • getContextModelClass

        Returns:
        the WorldModel for this simulation

      • getPlaceFiles

        public HashMap<String,InputStream> getPlaceFiles()
        Get the image files from the Simulation Data which represent places. This files are in fact a white image with black dots wherever a place should be created.
        Returns:
        a Map of with a name-file pair per place type

      • getOverlayFiles

        public HashMap<String,InputStream> getOverlayFiles()
        Get the image files from the Simulation Data which represent overlays. An overlay is an image map with a value for each position from the map.
        Returns:
        a Map of with a name-file pair per overlays

      • getSprites

        public HashMap<String,InputStream> getSprites()
        Get the sprites of the size given as a parameter.
        Returns:
        a map with the filename-InputStream pair per sprite image

      • getSpriteNames

        public ArrayList<String> getSpriteNames()
        Get the names of the sprites available in the simulation.
        Returns:
        a map with the filename-InputStream pair per sprite image

      • getWallsFile

        public InputStream getWallsFile()
        Retrieve from the simulation data an InputStream for the image that represents the walkable areas (white) and the walls (black) in the simulated world.
        Returns:
        the InputStream for the image file with the walls

      • getBackgroundFile

        public InputStream getBackgroundFile()
        Retrieve from the simulation data an InputStream for the image that represents the background (white) and the walls (black) in the simulated world.
        Returns:
        the InputStream for the image file with the background

      • getConfigFile

        public org.apache.commons.configuration.XMLConfiguration getConfigFile()
        Get an InputSream linked to the simulation configuration file.
        Returns:
        the inputstream with the configuration

      • getFile

        protected abstract InputStream getFile(String path)
        Retrieve a file from the SimulationData by its path.
        Parameters:
        path - a String representing the path within the folder or jar file
        Returns:
        the InputStream for that path

      • getFilesByPath

        protected abstract HashMap<String,InputStream> getFilesByPath(String path)
        Gets the files from the simulation data associated to the given type.

        For instance, calling getFilesOfType(FileType.OVERLAY) will return a Map with the names of the overlay, and the InputStreams to them.

        Parameters:
        path - to the type of files to be retrieved
        Returns:
        a map with pairs of overlay names and their data

      • getFileNamesByPath

        protected abstract ArrayList<String> getFileNamesByPath(String path)

        Gets the names of the files from the simulation data associated to the given type.

        For instance, calling getFilesOfType(FileType.OVERLAY) will return an ArrayList with the names of the overlays.

        This method is similar to getFilesByPath, but does not actually open the files. Use wisely to avoid having too many open files at a time.

        Parameters:
        path - to the type of files to be retrieved
        Returns:
        an ArrayList with the file overlay names and their data
